intro: Draba schoenleinii, commonly known as the alpine whitlow, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its simple, basal leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It is an annual or biennial species, often found in high-altitude environments. Draba schoenleinii is known for its ability to withstand harsh climates and is a common component of alpine flora.
